subsc: Health,Central government administration,Sanitation,Pre-primary education,Other social services
trustfund: TF029595-PHRD-HEALTH SECTOR REFORM PROJECT,TF022914-PHRD-SOCIAL SECTOR REHABILITATION,TF025330-PHRD-SOCIAL SECTOR RESTRUCTURING

abstracts.cdata!:
The Project ratings convey satisfactory
            project outcomes, likely sustainability, with only modest
            institutional development impacts. Lessons are addressed as
            follows. The model established by the Family Assistance
            Program (PRAF) under the project, aims at protecting the
            most vulnerable groups, from potentially, negative impacts
            of economic structural adjustment, and from the effects of
            absolute poverty. It provides financial incentives to poor
            families, including significant impact on improving the
            nutrition, health and education conditions of the family. As
            such, experience shows that demand-side interventions need
            to be accompanied by provision of effective social
            protection, to ensure coverage for demand incentives. In
            addition, the appropriately structured community
            participation, contributed to sustainability, based on four
            key successful elements in water and sanitation: training
            and community participation; community involvement in the
            provision of spare parts and supplies; use of appropriate
            technology; and, nomination of promoters within the
            councils, able to ensure information dissemination on health
            matters, and motivated to sustain the system. However, links
            between nutrition and education should be reinforced;
            strategic attention to infrastructure activities could
            further improve outcomes; and, improved communications could
            reduce delays, particularly as experienced during
            implementation regarding disbursement requests, and
            replenishment of the Special Account.
